title: Shaphat
html: SHAPHAT(Shaʹphat) [a shortened form of Shephatiah, meaning “Jehovah Has Judged”].1. A chieftain representing the tribe of Simeon as one of the spies who spent 40 days in the Promised Land; son of Hori.—Nu 13:2, 5, 25; see SPIES.2. One of King David’s herdsmen; son of Adlai. The flocks Shaphat cared for were in the low plains.—1Ch 27:29.3. Father of the prophet Elisha.—1Ki 19:16, 19; 2Ki 3:11; 6:31.4. A descendant of Gad who lived in Bashan.—1Ch 5:11, 12.5. One of King David’s post-exilic descendants.—1Ch 3:22.
